Description: Face of terracotta figurine. Mould-made. Nile silt clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallel in Stuttgart from Egypt dated to the 2nd century AD (Fischer 1994, no.1044). Label at back: "Aug 1/23 Naukratis". Transferred 2003 from Civic Center Museum (originally The Commercial Museum, which dates back to the early 1900s). Fischer, J. 1994, Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber, Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen, Tübinger Studien zur Archäologie und Kunstgeschichte 14, Tübingen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.465) (Phase 1)
